dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, welcome back, everyone! Kicking us off today, we've got some important travel news, especially if you're planning on flying out of Astana, Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, welcome back, everyone! Kicking us off today, we've got some important travel news, especially if you're planning on flying out of Astana, Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? What's going on there? Anything major travelers need to be aware of?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? What's going on there? Anything major travelers need to be aware of?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, uh, pretty significant, actually. Astana International Airport is going to temporarily suspend runway operations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's, uh, pretty significant, actually. Astana International Airport is going to temporarily suspend runway operations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Astana International Airport will temporarily suspend runway operations due to scheduled maintenance, which is expected to affect flight schedules in September and October.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Suspend? Like, totally shut down? For how long, um, exactly?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Suspend? Like, totally shut down? For how long, um, exactly?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, not totally. It's for scheduled maintenance, and it's going to affect flights through both September *and* October.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, not totally. It's for scheduled maintenance, and it's going to affect flights through both September and October.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Astana International Airport will temporarily suspend runway operations due to scheduled maintenance, which is expected to affect flight schedules in September and October.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, September and October. So, like, daily closures? Or specific days?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, September and October. So, like, daily closures? Or specific days?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good question! The airport's press service said it'll be unavailable daily, but only from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Astana time. So, like, middle of the day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good question! The airport's press service said it'll be unavailable daily, but only from ten o clock a m. to six o clock p m. Astana time. So, like, middle of the day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On these dates, the runway will be unavailable daily from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. (Astana time) for takeoffs and landings, the statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so not a full 24-hour shutdown, which is, uh, something. What's the reason for this, though? Just routine stuff?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so not a full twenty four-hour shutdown, which is, uh, something. What's the reason for this, though? Just routine stuff?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. They're calling it routine airfield maintenance. It's all about improving flight safety and, you know, service quality for airlines and passengers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. They're calling it routine airfield maintenance. It's all about improving flight safety and, you know, service quality for airlines and passengers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The repairs are part of routine airfield maintenance aimed at improving flight safety and service quality for airlines and passengers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Makes sense. Safety first, right? [interrupts] But what if someone's, like, flying during that window?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes sense. Safety first, right? But what if someone's, like, flying during that window?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And hey, there's a small window where things *will* be normal. From September 5th to the 7th, the runway's open, flights operate as usual.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And hey, there's a small window where things will be normal. From September fifth to the seventh, the runway's open, flights operate as usual.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was also clarified that the runway will be open from September 5 to 7, and flights will operate as usual during that period, although some schedule adjustments may still occur.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, okay, that's a little relief for some. But I guess people still need to double-check their flights, even then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, okay, that's a little relief for some. But I guess people still need to double-check their flights, even then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Even for those dates, they said some adjustments *could* still happen. The big takeaway is: check with your airline. Seriously, before you head out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Even for those dates, they said some adjustments could still happen. The big takeaway is: check with your airline. Seriously, before you head out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...although some schedule adjustments may still occur. Passengers are advised to check with their airlines for up-to-date information in advance of their travel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely don't wanna get caught off guard, especially with that 10 to 6 closure. Good heads-up, Host_A.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely don't wanna get caught off guard, especially with that ten to six closure. Good heads-up, Host A.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Anytime, Host_B. Always better to be prepared.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Anytime, Host B. Always better to be prepared.
